Journal.Title: Acta crystallographica. Section C, Structural chemistry

Article.ArticleTitle: Crystal structure and self-assembly on graphite of a pyrazolo[1,5-c]pyrimidine derivative.

AbstractText: The crystal structure of the heterocyclic compound 2-(4-methoxyphenyl)-7-phenylpyrazolo[1,5-c]pyrimidine, C<sub>19</sub>H<sub>15</sub>N<sub>3</sub>O, has been determined and its self-assembly on the surface of graphite has been examined using atomic force microscopy (AFM). The title compound crystallized in the monoclinic space group P2<sub>1</sub>/c, with two independent molecules in the asymmetric unit. The packing of the L-shaped molecules in the crystal is governed by arene interactions, in the absence of any conventional hydrogen-bonding interactions. The packing arrangement reveals four types of dimeric motifs stabilized by π-π and C-H...π interactions. At low coverage, molecules assemble into long needle-like islands on the graphite surface. High-resolution AFM images reveal that the molecules interact through weak noncovalent interactions between the aromatic H atoms and the methoxy O atoms.
